alert.note: Alert for Northern Harrison; Southern Harrison; Southern Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:10PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Harrison and southern Jackson Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 510 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Grand Bay to Gulfport. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Moss Point, St. Martin, Escatawpa, Gautier, D`iberville, Latimer, Helena, Gulf Hills, Gulf Park Estates, Hickory Hills, Lyman, Vancleave and Gulfport Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 29 and 76. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Northern Harrison; Southern Harrison; Southern Jackson
